quotes:
[]Author: David St;
Rating: 5
When: 5 months ago
Great hotel near the Vatican. The hotel was close to public transport and where the locals ate. So getting an authentic Local experience and food was simple.

Author: Amanda Rose;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Overall we enjoyed our experience. Rooms were clean and nice. Staff met accommodations. We only ate there for morning breakfast which was the same each morning. Not many additional amenities to the hotel. Very close to Vatican but far from other tourists stops

Author: Bob P.;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Great location near everything! Friendly staff with good english. That's important to me since I'm totally ignorant of other languages. I might have been " put on the elevator" a bit due to a "reservation foul-up" that wouldn't make the room price I had reserved available for 2 days. They gave me an "upgraded" room for the first 2 days for the original price but said I would either have to move to the cheaper room after that or pay the upgraded price to stay in the original room. I decided to stay put. Who wants to pack up and move? Long story short it might have been a simple bait and switch type of thing, but I'm not sure. Oh, the room is nice but I don't know what the "upgrade might be". Recommend none the less.

Author: Kay Munsterteiger;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Great location to get to the Vatican, nice and clean rooms, helpful staff, great hot breakfast

Author: M G;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Elegant hotel located on a 5 minute walk from St. Peter's square. We received a room upgrade upon arrival, which was a nice gesture. If possible get a room with balcony as you can see the Dome from there. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room was spacious and well-equipped as compared to other Rome hotels we have visited. The hotel's staff was courteous and welcoming (apart for some of the waitresses at the restaurant, who were not very attentive - e.g. they would not ask if you need anything like espresso). The hotel is in a very convenient and quiet location. One thing that could be improved is the breakfast - while the variety was satisfactory, it was one and the same each morning. The New Year's buffet dinner was a bit of a disappointment - the mood was not particularly festive and it closed before the start of the new year. Food was also a bit on the bland side.

Doesn't worth the money..8‚Ç¨ I could spend a lot better.

Author: Vladimir Kostic;
Rating: 1
When: 9 months ago
Don't go here... 8eur ticket to see sad plants..many of them half dead... parts of the garden are literally a mess there are many beautiful gardens in Rome that are better taken cared and more pleasant to spend time in... the only worthwhile place was a bench in bamboo section with a nice view (actually bamboo section was the only decent part) All in all it was very sad experience for us

Author: Alice Ho;
Rating: 2
When: 8 months ago
Maybe it's the time of the year. Not much plants nor flowers to see. Also not very well kept.

Author: Dri Kool (thekoolitaly);
Rating: 5
When: 10 months ago
An absolute delight. During the summer can be an oasis to hide away from sun. Take a guided tour , highly recommended... although I'm not sure if their tours are only in Italian.

Author: Kuala Bound;
Rating: 4
When: 10 months ago
The hill is a huge help to the beauty of the garden. I was impressed by the massive ancient platanus next to the eleven fountains steps. And i liked also the tropical greenhouse but i fear they should find a way to increase its roof not enough high. Fens valley looked a bit messy. The Samples garden can be risky so pay attention to bees.

[]Author: M in Paris;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
Amazing ceiling painting from Raffaelo. It is mind blowing and definitely one of the more hidden unknown museums

Author: JUZER KAPADIA;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
The wealthy Sienese banker Agostino Chigi commissioned this villa in 1508 for his lavish banquets and for sojourns with the courtesan Imperia, who allegedly inspired one of the Three Graces painted by Raphael in the Loggia of Cupid and Psyche. Designed by the Sienese architect Baldassare Peruzzi, the harmonious Farnesina, with a central block and projecting wings, is one of the first true Renaissance villas. Peruzzi decorated some of the interiors himself, such as the Sala della Prospettiva upstairs, in which illusionistic frescoes create the impression of looking out over Rome through a marble colonnade. The painted vault of the Sala di Galatea shows the position of the stars at the time of Chigi‚Äôs birth. After his death, the banking business collapsed, and in 1577 the villa was sold to the Farnese family.

Author: Andrew Potts;
Rating: 5
When: 6 months ago
Beautiful building, amazing Raphael frescoes.

Author: A. Lexander;
Rating: 2
When: 10 months ago
"Don't download the guide app it takes too long almost 5 minutes per room" was said to us when we bought tickets and wanted to download the free guide app they ADVERTISED AS PART OF TICKET... What a joke. And that for 10‚Ç¨. Very rude and unfriendly people at ticket counter.

The most amazing library I have ever seen in my life and probably the most amazing one I will ever see in my hole life. üòØ Just extraordinary fantastic. Extremely happy to be taken there.

Rating: 5

A neighborhood I always visit when in Rome. Lovely atmosphere, great restaurants, imaginative shops and souvenir shops. A lovely place for a stroll whether summer or winter.

Best place in Rome to eat!

Author: PREMIUM Shop;

Nothing special. Go during the night.

[]Author: Thomas Bollman;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
This place is much much bigger than it looks when you first walk in. Lots of places to sit and lounge around. Bartenders were very nice and their English was fine. Great for groups to sit around a table to have a drink or seven. Will go back on my next trip to Rome and when I‚Äôm not so hungover already.

Author: Pondz Meme;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Great staff. Great food. Great wine. Great price. The place is great. I threw a gathering for 17 people for my 19th bday and it was so nice. Totally recommend!!

Author: Michal Glinka;
Rating: 3
When: 2 years ago
We arrived around 7pm for some good cocktails, but there was no other guests at the time. The bar was completely empty. The service was very good. The style of the bar is probably dated to the 90/00's looking on the interieur.

Author: Wesam Rukun;
Rating: 3
When: a year ago
An ok food. But the location is great.

Author: Jorge R Tomey;

When: 2 years ago
Good decor, gin and tonics ‚Ç¨8 per. Closes at 0200h. Music wasn‚Äôt very good.

[]Author: Sean Hollier;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
A really nice location on the West side of Rome, found it by accident in a Park area, beautiful views over Rome and the River Tiber. An easy walk back into the main areas, When you are at the location, walk a littler further North West into the park area before heading back down.

Author: Siria ‚Äúsiriadotcom‚Äù Scandellari;
Rating: 5
When: 11 months ago
What can I say? It's one of the most beautiful locations in Rome! There's no need to elaborate, just visit this gorgeous place if you're in the area. Day or night, it will take your breath away!

Author: pacciunettu;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Beautiful as all Rome. And the view is one of the best view of Rome. High suggested in sunset time and night time. Deservr a view.

Author: Ahlam Saad;
Rating: 5
When: 6 months ago
Wooow that wonderful place, it's beautiful and the atmosphere is so comfortable and quite.. You can also see Roma with all it's beautiful rooftops, the view is awesome

Author: David Lown;
Rating: 5
When: 4 months ago
On account of its size, it is better known locally as Il Fontanone (the Big Fountain). The fountain is crowned with the coat of arms of Pope Paul V (r. 1605-21), who commissioned its creation.

[]Author: Lydia J;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
A very well kept park in Rome! Really like this park because it is very beautiful,huge, well kept and it also have different view points. Totally recommend this park if you just wanna go for some walk and especially if you have kids or dog! A bit tricky to find a car park if you are coming with car.

Author: Naz Shirani;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Lovely park in Rome. So many beautiful turtles! Avoid Viva Bistro, it was awful!

Author: Khalid Sohail;
Rating: 4
When: a month ago
Very nice, big park. Its excellent for running, cycling and even for picnics. There is a lake inside the park which is very beautiful. There is also a cafe Vivi that is very good.

Author: MaryYa;
Rating: 4
When: 3 months ago
Nice place for a wolk or sports activities. Plenty of space, high trees, lakes with adorable ducks. There is a villa house and green labyrinth on a territory but no access into it. Also searching for a parking place might be a struggle.

Author: Pauline Marie Calimlim;
Rating: 4
When: 9 months ago
Huge park with such beautiful surprises! Great for walks and exercise. It also has a children's playground and many benches to seat on.
